title: Box Shooter
description: First person shooter demo for course of Introduction to Game Development of Michigan State University (It can take up to 10 min to fully load, hehe)

title: Roller Madness
description: 3D platformer demo for course of Introduction to Game Development of Michigan State University (It can take up to 10 min to fully load, hehe)

title: Interest groups
description: Java REST API and Front in Angular for connecting groups of persons

title: IoT lock architecture contest Yale
description: With my team from the course Software Architecture by teams, we won the contest for designing an architecture for Yale smart lock alarams using IoT

title: Research assistance on UnaCloud
description: I worked on UnaCloud, a project to use Virtual Machines on unused college equipment (computer labs, for example). I mostly worked on creating a REST API (Grails) with a library to connect to it (Java), and solve concurrency issues using VBox Manager CLI. I also maintained their architecture (Messaging through Rabbit MQ and TCP sockets)

title: Pecheo: Finalist on Act In Space Hackathon Colombia
description: With my group we ideated a fuel optimization system using ESA technology from space stations. We were among the top 6 ideas.

title: 3R: Datos Abiertos DC Hackathon Colombia
description: With my team, we developed a map for recyclers in Bogotá, Colombia to optimize their routes and track their movements.

title: Senehack: Y4PT Transport Hackathon
description: With my team, we developed an app for matching cyclists and walkers to go together to different locations in Bogotá, Colombia.

title: Indoor Location inside Universidad De Los Andes
description: Andes' goal was to make a cheap indoor location Android application that would only use the WiFi RFID signals. our pilot started at Universidad de Los Andes with a KNN Algorithm that achieved a typical error of 2 meters. However, since it was too hard to train the algorithm it was stopped.

title: Gaucher Awareness website Colombia
description: I developed a webpage to show the information of Gaucher Disease from what we had on Takeda. This was based on an international website and I adapted it all using React

title: Know HAE website Colombia
description: I developed a webpage to show the information of Hereditary Angioedema (HAE) Disease from what we had on Takeda. I modified the international website to suit Colombia´s market needs

title: Fabry website Colombia, Perú and Ecuador
description: I developed a webpage to show the information of Fabry Disease from what we had on Takeda. I modified the international website to suit Colombia´s market needs buuut I never got to see my work live before leaving the company

title: Bogotá Botanical Garden Android app
description: After making a context analysis for the Mobile Development course of Universidad de Los Andes, I developed with a partner a mobile app using Kotlin and Android Jetpack for AndroidX devices to get realtime location inside a map with the different activities and plants you could locate inside the Bogotá Botanical Garden

title: Top Image
description: PWA to post your own images and make contests with other. There is the option to use private rooms to invite anyone you like and start working. Voting is completely reactive (Mongo streams and socket io) as well as the ranking of the images

title: Picross VS
description: Reactive web app to play picross with your friends on real time. Achieved using Meteor and the MERN stack

title: Academical Reborn
description: Web app to help students plan their schedule with different subjects from Universidad de Los Andes. It started as an event planner and then was modified for doing the above purpose. Sadly it wasn´t used as expected and it was decided to leave it like this

title: Open API Automated SDK generation with Docker container Amazon ECS
description: I helped in the implementation of a Docker container that generates automated SDKs of our API using OpenAPI, to ease client integration. This code is not public, hence I can only tell you about the experience

title: Automated information retrieval from web pages
description: The title says it all. I´ve helped with the code for retrieving information from public websites automatically with scheduling services and on-demand running in AWS Lambdas. I can´t post any code or sources since this is private

title: BrowZ: My thesis
description: My thesis was... awesome. I still remember all those afternoons talking to my best friend in college about how we would implement it, and we focused all our efforts on developing a simple app that could compare a web app across different browsers and sizes, and highlight the differences among them. There's too much work to be done but I'm proud of what we accomplished.

title: SeneCare multi-uses developer
description: Just before receiving my major certificate in Universidad de Los Andes, one of our teachers was tasked to create a mobile app that tooka dvantage of Contact Tracing to know if a student had been in contact with someone who was infected with COVID-19. With this SeneCare was born and I worked in an Express backend to receive requests, a Vue JS dashboard for doctors and a mobile app for students that takes advantage of Bluetooth to use the Contact Tracing algorithm

title: Inception... I am Sergio Guzmán
description: This is my personal webpage to show who I am to the world. I used Vue with Vue X and Vue Composition API just for testing

title: Digital Identity History Dashboard
description: Development of the history dashboard for Truora's Digital Identity product, including dynamic visualization of cards per multiple validators: face and voice recognition, document validation, phone and email authentication, enterprise data validation and identity questions

title: Dynamic Face Validation Filters
description: Architecture for applying dynamic filters to the faces of persons in uploaded images

title: Implementation of native Android and iOS SDKs for face and document validation
description: Help in the implementation of document, face match and liveness views for using as part of a SDK built in VIPER for Android and iOS mobile apps. Our client's don't have to worry about making the UI or managing permissions since we do it all for them.
